column1: Írensaga was a tall peak in the White Mountains
column2: notable for its saw-toothed crest. In between Írensaga
column3: Starkhorn and Dwimorberg there was Harrowdale.  Meriadoc Brandybuck saw this mountain on 9 March  when King Théoden came to Dunharrow after the Battle of the Hornburg.

column1: The name means "iron-saw" in Old English
column2: with reference to its serrated ridge

column1: In earlier versions of the legendarium Írensaga lacked an accent.
